_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.0 Executive Summary
1.1. The Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Rinchem Company LLC., Hollister, CA Hazardous Material Storage Warehouse (CSC 15). 
Rinchem Company, LLC. (CSC 15) is committed to being a responsible member of the community in which it operates by giving top priority to operating in a safe and environmentally sound manner. Policy dictates that
Rinchem personnel continuously identify methods to reduce the risk of handling hazardous materials and to reduce the risk to the community and environment through the implementation of new technology and procedures. This commitment to safe and environmentally sound operations is documented in the Team Member Handbook, and the mission statement, which are available to all employees. The Rinchem Safety motto states:
"KNOW SAFETY....NO ACCIDENTS ." Rinchem Company, LLC. is committed to provide a safe working environment for its staff members, its customers and the public, and maintains that
"NO JOB IS MORE IMPORTANT THAN THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF OUR STAFF MEMBERS, OUR COMMUNITIES, AND THE ENVIRONMENT." We recognize that the responsibilities for safety and health are shared among:
Management, in particular the Director of Quality, ES&H, accepts the responsibility for leadership of the safety and health program, for its effectiveness and improvement, and for providing the safeguards required to ensure safe conditions. 
Managers and supervisors , with full support of EHS professionals are responsible for ensuring processes are documented to reinforce safety as well as the use of engineering controls as the preferred method of promoting safety and eliminating unsafe conditions. 
Employees are responsible for cooperation with all aspects of the safety and health program including compliance with all rules, documented procedures, and regulations and for continuously practicing safety while performing their duties. They are also responsible for stopping activities that may lead to injur

ies to themselves or others. Staff members, being the most familiar with actual operations, are responsible to document suggestions for continuous improvements. Each employee is granted the authority to stop work if it is deemed unsafe. The job will not be continued until the work methods are evaluated and changed, if necessary, to make the work area safe.
Management continues to do all it can to protect the Health and Safety of all employees and to provide a safe working environment. However, safety requires the participation of everyone...only you can make safety a reality. Be alert for conditions which appear unsafe and report unsafe conditions immediately. Employees are encouraged to report any accident, "near miss", exposure, incident, spill or release.
1.2. A Description of the Hollister, CA (CSC 15)Warehousing a RMP EHS(regulated substance)
1.2.1. Description of the Hollister, CA (CSC 15)Warehousing Hazardous Materials in their original UN/DOT Packaging
The Hollister, CA (CSC 15)Warehouse is located at 2301 Bert Drive, Hollister, CA, 95023. The facility provides transportation and public warehousing services for manufacturers, distributors and end users of UN/DOT prepackaged specialty chemicals. Warehousing activities include shipping, receiving and storage of chemicals as specified by customer requirements. The chemicals stored at the Hollister, CA (CSC 15) warehouse include chemicals containing toxic hazards. The only RMP EHS(regulated substances) stored at the warehouse above threshold quantities are hydrochloric acid (conc. 37% or greater) and ammonia 20% or greater (in the form of ammonium hydroxide 29%). 
1.2.2. Description of the Warehousing Process
Rinchem receives its listed EHS (regulated substance) by truck as shipped from the manufacturer or distributor. The material is unloaded from the truck using a forklift and staged for inspection. After the material passes quality and safety inspection, it is placed into the hazard specific storage area unti

l it is shipped to the end user. The storage location of each material is tracked in an electronic inventory management system. After an order is received, Rinchem prepares to ship the above listed chemicals as ordered by the end user. The material is picked and staged for quality and safety inspection. After the material passes inspection, it is loaded on to a truck for shipment using a powered industrial truck (PIT).
1.3. Worst-Case Release Scenario
-	A worst case release scenario was prepared for the accidental release of the largest container of regulated substances with the greatest toxic endpoint.  
1.4. The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps
Release response and reporting are documented on SOP-00002- Business Continuity Plan-Business Process, the facility-specific Emergency Action Plan (RECORD-000078), and Work Instruction-00652-Incident Reporting. Additionally, Rinchem Company, LLC. Hollister, CA (CSC 15) is included in the CERS CONSOLIDATED EMERGENCY RESPONSE / CONTINGENCY PLAN
1.5. The Five Year Accident History 
There has never been a reportable accident involving hydrochloric acid (conc. 37% or greater) or ammonia 20% (as ammonium hydroxide 29%) at the Hollister, CA Warehouse.
1.6. The Emergency Action Plan
Overall safety at the Rinchem Company, LLC. Hollister, CA (CSC 15) warehouse is governed not only by our ability to prevent accidental releases of hydrochloric acid (conc. 37% or greater) or ammonia 20%  from occurring, but also by the ability to mitigate any accidental releases of the above mentioned material. Rinchem has developed an emergency action plan to minimize the effects of accidental releases of regulated substances to employees. Rinchem Company, LLC. Hollister, CA (CSC 15) is a non-responding facility and utilizes the services of contracted emergency responders for spill cleanup.
